verb.description: Send off to a destination or for a purpose.
examples: he dispatched messages back to base
the mayor dispatched 150 police officers to restore order

verb.description: Deal with (a task, problem, or opponent) quickly and efficiently.

noun.description: The sending of someone or something to a destination or for a purpose.
examples: a resolution authorizing the dispatch of a peacekeeping force

noun.description: An official report on state or military affairs.
examples: in his battle dispatch he described the gunner's bravery

noun.description: The killing of someone or something.
examples: the legendary dispatch of villains by a hero

origin: Early 16th century: from Italian dispacciare or Spanish despachar expedite, from dis-, des- (expressing reversal) + the base of Italian impacciare, Spanish empachar hinder.
